Posts.Content: Thanks for that story. I wish every woman could read it, not just the ones on this board! And you are right. You have to educate yourself and take care of yourself and not just rely on what doctors think. I have a question that I would like to ask everyone. Do you think that yearly mammograms after 20 years, can cause cancer? My other question is "do mammograms really save lives?" Judging from this last story, it sounds like it saved hers.
Posts.Title: Ambiguous Mammogram Results 1 2

Posts.Content: I totally agree with bjg's reply. The only way they can tell if it's a cyst or a tumor is by giving you an ultrasound.
Posts.Title: Just got results from first mammo - am a little scared... 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi everyone: I learned something VITAL last summer when my sister-in-law was diagnosed with breast cancer. I want to share the knowledge with you. She had her regular yearly mammo (18 years of them) and it showed nothing. Four months later she found a lump and it was cancer. She learned that mammograms do not find all cancers. When she was given an ultrasound, they could see the tumor. So now I have decided that when I have my yearly mammogram, I am also going to have an ultrasound at the same time - if my insurance doesn't want to pay for it, then I will! from Sister.
Posts.Title: Just got results from first mammo - am a little scared... 1 2

Posts.Content: I think if anyone has a lump they should have it removed and biopsied or aspirated and biopsied. No ifs, ands, or buts!! That's all I have to say!
Posts.Title: Just got results from first mammo - am a little scared... 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi again! I still think you should have a "needle aspiration" for peace of mind. It does not really hurt. Just stings a little, but not as much as a vaccination. It was not my first mammogram, but if they see something strange, they should do whatever you would like them to do. I can't stand "not knowing" if there's anything suspicious as far as my health is concerned!
Posts.Title: Just got results from first mammo - am a little scared... 1 2

Posts.Content: Hi cj - thanks for answering. I would not skip my mammos either because I'm now 59. I just wonder what an expert would say about this radiation thing. I know we don't have any choice until they figure out a better diagnostic device. My friend was saved by a mammogram a few years ago, just like you were. Take care. Sue
Posts.Title: Mammogram Risk of Radiation

Posts.Content: I'm scared. A doctor on TV said that women 50 (NOT 40) and older should have a mammogram every year or two. He said that if you have mammograms for 20 or 30 years then you will get breast cancer from the radiation. Well I've been having mammograms every year since I was 40 - that's 20 years of mammograms.. And some of them were multiple x-rays because I had cysts and a terrible technician one year. She took about 12 x-rays because she couldn't get it right. The usual amount is 4 x-rays a year. Now I'm worried about radiation. Is there anyone on this board who knows the danger of mammograms - have they done any studies on this? Thank you for any answers or opinions.
Posts.Title: Mammogram Risk of Radiation

Posts.Content: When this happened to me I insisted on a needle biopsy. It turned out to be a benign cyst. My health care is so nice that they let me have whatever test I ask for. I hope yours is as good. Even if you have to pay for it, I think you should do it for peace of mind. I didn't want to stake my life on what a radiologist "thought" was be benign. from Careful Sister
Posts.Title: Just got results from first mammo - am a little scared... 1 2

Posts.Content: I know some of you who read this will become angry or disgusted with me for writing it, but it is just the truth. I am 54. Sometimes I get so fed up with worrying about breast cancer that I want to go and get prophylactic mastectomies. I don't need my breasts anyway. They are cumbersome, usually tender or painful, and my main cancer site. My husband said it would be alright with him because he was only 28 when his mom died from breast cancer. Both his daughters are in their 30's and have one of the BC genes. Without breasts, I would feel free from worry, free of mammograms and biopsies and the fear they bring, (I have to take Ibuprophen for a week after a mammogram because I have cysts and the pain from a mammogram is bad) and could jog and ride horses without having to hold my breasts because of pain! I am serious about this. Breast cancer is just too common. My grandmother had it and now my sister-in-law, a co-worker, and a friend from high school. I have a friend who is as "flat as a board." (Naturally) She has a nice life and doesn't mind not having a bustline. I wouldn't mind either. Thank you for letting me vent my anger at breast cancer.
Posts.Title: Can anyone help with MICRO-CALCIFICATIONS???

Posts.Content: Hi Tricky: you asked for opionions so here goes mine: If I were you, I would want both breasts removed and in time, have reconstructive surgery done. I don't have any desire to guess when it comes to cancer. There are excellent plastic surgeons who can build you new CANCER-FREE breasts and then you will have PEACE OF MIND! Whatever you choose to do, I wish you good luck and a complete cure. Sister
Posts.Title: lumpectomy vs. mastectomy?

Posts.Content: Hi Amy - if the lump is sore then it probably is not cancer. But you should get it checked out for peace of mind if nothing else. JMO
Posts.Title: Found a lump and am scared

Posts.Content: I, too, have a terrible fear of breast cancer, especially since an in-law of mine only has one year to live because of it. 18 years of mammograms didn't see it. She found a lump 3 months after her last mammogram, and now she's dying. I don't see what is wrong with having your breasts removed after the age of 55. They are only milk glands. It's not like they are needed. Just the opposite: no more mammograms, biopsies, panic attacks about lumps, and ESPECIALLY, NO MORE F E A R !!! I'm not too worried about uterine or ovary cancer, because it is much more rare, and the tests of finding uterine cancer early are excellent. What do you think about what I just said??? Am I wrong to want to live flat-chested but with no fear??
Posts.Title: Fear of Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: If you have more than one "lump" then they are probably cysts. The surgeon will do his own ultra-sound, then tell you what he thinks you should do. I had a suspicious "cyst" removed against everyone's advice, for peace of mind. It was benign, but I like the "peace of mind" thing! I don't think cysts become malignant, but you can never be "sure." Good luck to you - sister
Posts.Title: Breast Lumps

Posts.Content: It sounds to me like you are just fine, but if I had a lump I would want it taken out for peace of mind.
Posts.Title: Breast Lump questions
